Ethics Threat Analyzer ‚öñÔ∏è ‚Äã

Use this interactive tool to identify potential threats to fundamental ethical principles (Integrity, Objectivity, Professional Competence, Confidentiality, and Professional Behavior) and determine appropriate safeguards.

Ethics Threat Analyzer

Select a category or search for a scenario to identify potential ethical threats and required safeguards as per the ICAN Code of Ethics 2023.

Holding Financial Interest in Client
High Risk

A member of the audit team or their immediate family member holds shares or other financial interests in the audit client.

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat

Safeguards

  • Dispose of the direct financial interest immediately.
  • Remove the individual from the audit team.
  • If the interest is indirect and immaterial, no specific safeguard may be needed, but disclosure is recommended.
Loan from Audit Client
Medium Risk

Accepting a loan or guarantee from an audit client that is a bank or financial institution.

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat

Safeguards

  • Ensure the loan is made under normal lending procedures, terms, and requirements.
  • If the loan is material to the audit firm or individual, apply an independent review of the work.
Loan to/from Non-Bank Client
Critical Risk

Accepting a loan from, or making a loan to, an audit client that is NOT a bank or financial institution.

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat

Safeguards

  • Strictly prohibited if material.
  • No safeguard can reduce the threat to an acceptable level unless the loan is immaterial to both the firm and the client.
Close Business Relationship
High Risk

Entering into a close business relationship with an audit client or its management (e.g., joint venture, marketing arrangement).

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat
  • Intimidation Threat

Safeguards

  • Terminating the business relationship.
  • Reducing the magnitude of the relationship so that the financial interest is immaterial.
  • Refusing to perform the audit engagement.
Family Member is Director/Officer
High Risk

An immediate family member of the audit team is a Director or Officer of the client.

Threats

  • Familiarity Threat
  • Self-Interest Threat

Safeguards

  • Remove the individual from the audit team.
  • Structure the responsibilities of the audit team so the professional does not deal with matters within the responsibility of the family member.
Serving as Director/Officer
Critical Risk

A partner or employee of the firm serves as a Director or Officer of the audit client.

Threats

  • Self-Review Threat
  • Self-Interest Threat

Safeguards

  • Strictly Prohibited. No safeguard can reduce this threat to an acceptable level.
  • The individual must resign from the position or the firm must decline the audit.
Recent Service with Client
Critical Risk

A member of the audit team has recently served as a Director or Officer of the client covering the period under audit.

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat
  • Self-Review Threat
  • Familiarity Threat

Safeguards

  • The individual shall NOT be assigned to the audit team for that period.
Contingent Fees
Critical Risk

Charging fees calculated on a predetermined basis relating to the outcome of a transaction or the result of the work.

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat

Safeguards

  • Strictly Prohibited for audit engagements.
  • Fees should be based on time, skill, and complexity of the work.
Overdue Fees
Medium Risk

A significant amount of fees from an audit client remains unpaid for a long time (e.g., considered as a loan).

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat
  • Intimidation Threat

Safeguards

  • Discuss the level of outstanding fees with the audit committee.
  • Involve an additional professional who did not take part in the audit to provide advice or review the work.
Accepting Gifts
Medium Risk

Accepting gifts or hospitality from an audit client.

Threats

  • Self-Interest Threat
  • Familiarity Threat
  • Intimidation Threat

Safeguards

  • Prohibited unless the value is trivial and inconsequential.
  • If not trivial, decline the offer.

About this Tool ‚Äã

This analyzer is designed for Chartered Accountants and professional firms in Nepal following the Code of Ethics issued by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nepal (ICAN), which is based on the IESBA Handbook.

Common Threat Categories ‚Äã

  1. Self-Interest Threat: Financial or other interests influencing judgment.
  2. Self-Review Threat: Evaluating one's own previous work.
  3. Advocacy Threat: Promoting a client's position to the point of compromising objectivity.
  4. Familiarity Threat: Long or close relationships leading to over-sympathetic behavior.
  5. Intimidation Threat: Deterrence from acting objectively due to pressure.
